channel.title: Posts on Dylan Pfannenstiel's Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dylan Pfannenstiel's Site

item.title: Using Python and R
item.description: Using R with Python I will be exploring how python and R can "talk" to each other accomplish a variety of tasks. The reticulate package enables R and python to pass information between one another and communicate. library(reticulate) air<-airquality #defined dataset in R Now we can use the dataset from R in python! r.air.head() #accessed this dataset we created in R in python ## Ozone Solar.R Wind Temp Month Day ## 0 41 190 7.

item.title: Test Post 1
item.description: Hi, Welcome! I'm sad that my college career is coming to and end in this fashion, AKA zoom U. Link to project 1 Link to google x<-2+2 y<-3+3 x+y ## [1] 10 install.packages("reticulate",repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") ## Installing package into '/stor/home/dmp2636/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/3.6' ## (as 'lib' is unspecified) library(reticulate) x="Hello UT" print(x) ## Hello UT ... ## Ellipsis
